intro: Wikstroemia albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, linear, and often covered with fine hairs. Wikstroemia albiflora is considered an endemic species, contributing to the unique botanical diversity of Hawaii.
